oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Cpl. Henry Marshall Misemer, Co. F, 3rd Tenn. Cav. Regt., USA, to wife Martha
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Misemer writes that officers are riding around the camp telling soldiers that they will be paroled and of Gen. Robert E. Lee's surrender at Richmond. He also says that he has heard that two of his comrades have come from Andersonville and are doing well. This was his last letter home. Misemer died on the USS Sultana on his way home from the war. Letter written on United States Sanitary Commission stationery. See also TSLA Mf. #2008 for a complete set of Misemer's letters.
